it.unibo.alchemist.boundary.monitors

Class Abstract2DDisplay<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • it.unibo.alchemist.boundary.monitors.Abstract2DDisplay<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphicalOutputMonitor<T>, OutputMonitor<T>, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Generic2DDisplay, MapDisplay

    public abstract class Abstract2DDisplay<T>
extends JPanel
implements GraphicalOutputMonitor<T>
    Abstract base-class for each display able a graphically represent a 2D space and simulation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        protected static <N extends Number,D extends Number> boolean envHasMobileObstacles(IEnvironment<?> env)
        Type Parameters:
        N - positions
        D - distances
        Parameters:
        env - the current environment
        Returns:
        true if env is subclass of IEnvironment2DWithObstacles and has mobile obstacles

      • finished

        public void finished(IEnvironment<T> environment,
                     ITime time,
                     long step)
        Description copied from interface: OutputMonitor
        This method will be called by the simulation once the whole simulation has finished, either because it reached its latest point or because the user stopped it. Thread safety note: no specific policy is defined for the control flow which will execute this method. A new thread could have been spawned or the same flow of the simulation may execute this method. This depends on the specific ISimulation implementation.
        Specified by:
        finished in interface OutputMonitor<T>
        Parameters:
        environment - The current environment
        time - The time at which the simulation ended
        step - The last step number

      • initialized

        public void initialized(IEnvironment<T> environment)
        Description copied from interface: OutputMonitor
        This method will be called by the simulation as soon as the initialization phase is completed. Thread safety note: no specific policy is defined for the control flow which will execute this method. A new thread could have been spawned or the same flow of the simulation may execute this method. This depends on the specific ISimulation implementation.
        Specified by:
        initialized in interface OutputMonitor<T>
        Parameters:
        environment - the environment

        Specified by:
        isRealTime in interface GraphicalOutputMonitor<T>
        Returns:
        true if this monitor is trying to draw in realtime

      • loadObstacles

        protected void loadObstacles()
        Updates the environment obstacles. The environment must be a subclass of IEnvironment2DWithObstacles.

      • setRealTime

        public void setRealTime(boolean rt)
        Description copied from interface: GraphicalOutputMonitor
        If enabled, the monitor tries to synchronize the simulation time with the real time, slowing down the simulator if needed. If the simulation is slower than the real time, then the display refreshes fast enough to keep the #DEFAULT_FRAME_RATE.
        Specified by:
        setRealTime in interface GraphicalOutputMonitor<T>
        Parameters:
        rt - true for the real time mode

      • setStep

        public void setStep(int step)
        Specified by:
        setStep in interface GraphicalOutputMonitor<T>
        Parameters:
        step - How many steps should be computed by the engine for the display to update the graphics

      • stepDone

        public void stepDone(IEnvironment<T> environment,
                     IReaction<T> r,
                     ITime time,
                     long step)
        Description copied from interface: OutputMonitor
        This method will be called by the simulation every time a simulation step is done. Thread safety note: no specific policy is defined for the control flow which will execute this method. A new thread could have been spawned or the same flow of the simulation may execute this method. This depends on the specific ISimulation implementation.
        Specified by:
        stepDone in interface OutputMonitor<T>
        Parameters:
        environment - The current environment
        r - The last reaction executed
        time - The time at this simulation point
        step - The current simulation step
